excel_table_conversion module

This module provides ExcelTableConverter class to extract tables from Excel files. To define the shape of tables in Excel files, ExcelTableFormat class is used.

copyright:

© 2025 by Jaywan Chung

license:

MIT

class excel_table_conversion.ExcelTableConverter(table_format, logger, transform_table=None)

Bases: object

Provides features for extracting tables from Excel files.

Note: To read an Excel file, pandas.read_excel() is used. Hence, a supported engine (xlrd, openpyxl, etc.) is required.

Parameters:

  • table_format (ExcelTableFormat) – A format for describing a valid table in Excel files. Only tables that meet this format will be extracted.

  • logger (logger.Logger) – A logger for storing messages from converter.

  • transform_table (Callabe, optional) – A callback function for transforming extracted tables. Default is None, which means doing nothing by calling identity_transform() function. For an example callback function, refer to the source code of add_longname_and_shortname().

Variables:

  • table_format (ExcelTableFormat) – The format describing a valid table in Excel files.

  • logger (logger.Logger) – The logger storing messages from converter.

Example callback function: The following function does no transform.
>>> def identity_transform(df, table_range, table):
...     return table
convert_all_to_csv(source_rootdir, target_rootdir, skip_converted=False, backup_excel=False, tail_in_csv_filename='') → None

Extract tables from Excel files and save as CSV files. All Excel files in root directory and subdirectories are converted. Tables in a single Excel file are merged and saved as a corresponding, single CSV file.

Parameters:

  • source_rootdir (str) – Root directory containing Excel files to be converted.

  • target_rootdir (str) – Target root directory that will contain converted CSV files.

  • skip_converted (bool, optional) – If True, skip converting Excel file if it is already converted; that is, a converted CSV file exists, and its last modification date is later than the last modification date of the Excel file. Default is False.

  • backup_excel (bool, optional) – If True, the original Excel file is copied into the target directory. Default is False. Note: If CSV conversion has been skipped, then backup is also skipped regardless of this option.

  • tail_in_csv_filename (str, optional) – A tail name to be attached in the original name. For example, if tail name is ‘_converted’, then excel.xlsx file is converted to excel_converted.csv file.

convert_to_csv(source_excel_filepath, target_csv_filepath) → None

Extract tables from source Excel file and save as the target CSV file. All tables in the Excel file are merged and saved as a single CSV file. Target directory will be created if missing.

Parameters:

  • source_excel_filepath (str) – Excel filepath to be extracted.

  • target_csv_filepath (str) – Target CSV filepath.

extract_table_from_excel_file(excel_filepath) → pandas.DataFrame

Extract all tables from an Excel file and merge into a single pandas DataFrame.

Note: To read an Excel file, pandas.read_excel() is used.

Parameters:

excel_filepath (str) – An Excel filepath.

Returns:

A merged table.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

extract_table_from_sheet(sheets, sheet_name) → pandas.DataFrame

Extract all tables from a target sheet (of an Excel file) and merge into a single pandas DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • sheets (dict) – All sheets (of an Excel file). This is a dictionary where the keys are sheet names and the items are pandas DataFrames.

  • sheet_name (str) – The name of the target sheet. Of all sheets, only the sheet named sheet_name is processed.

Returns:

A merged table.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

class excel_table_conversion.ExcelTableFormat(min_n_rows: int, min_n_cols: int, header_row_offset: int = 0, header_in_sheet_name: str = '', header_in_filename: str = '')

Bases: object

Represents a valid shape of a table and check the validity.

Parameters:

  • min_n_rows (int) – The minimum number of rows where a table must have.

  • min_n_cols (int) – The minimum number of columns where a table must have.

  • header_row_offset (int, optional) – The row offset of the header of a table. Default is 0, which means the first row of the table is header.

  • header_in_sheet_name (str, optional) – A sheet name must start with header_in_sheet_name. If not, the sheet is skipped. Default is ‘’.

  • header_in_filename (str, optional) – An Excel filename must start with header_in_filename. If not, the file is skipped. Default is ‘’.

acceptable_csv_filename(filename) → bool

Check to see if the filename is a valid CSV filename.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of a CSV file.

Returns:

True if filename starts with ExcelTableFormat.header_in_filename and ends with .csv.

Return type:

bool

acceptable_excel_filename(filename) → bool

Check to see if the filename is a valid Excel filename.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of an Excel file.

Returns:

True if filename starts with ExcelTableFormat.header_in_filename and ends with .xlsx.

Return type:

bool

acceptable_sheet_name(sheet_name) → bool

Check to see if the sheet name is valid.

Parameters:

sheet_name (str) – The name of a sheet.

Returns:

True if sheet_name starts with ExcelTableFormat.header_in_sheet_name.

Return type:

bool

header_in_filename: str = ''

An Excel filename must start with header_in_filename. If not, the file is skipped. Default is ‘’.

header_in_sheet_name: str = ''

A sheet name must start with header_in_sheet_name. If not, the sheet is skipped. Default is ‘’.

header_row_offset: int = 0

The row offset of the header of a table. Default is 0, which means the first row of the table is header.

min_n_cols: int

The minimum number of columns where a table must have.

min_n_rows: int

The minimum number of rows where a table must have.

excel_table_conversion.add_longname_and_shortname(df, table_range, table)

A callback function for adding longname and shortname columns to table. Can be used as an input for transform_table parameter of ExcelTableConverter class.

The longname and shortname appear in the first column, before the first row of the table. That is, the row offsets of longname and shortname are -2 and -1, respectively.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The entire dataframe containing the table.

  • table_range (table_extraction.TableRange) – The range of extracted table in df.

  • table (pandas.DataFrame) – The extracted table.

Returns:

The table transformed by adding longname and shortname columns.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

excel_table_conversion.identity_transform(df, table_range, table)

A callback function for transforming extracted tables. This function does nothing.

Note: To create a custom callback function, match the parameters and the return type.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The entire dataframe containing the table.

  • table_range (table_extraction.TableRange) – The range of the extracted table in df.

  • table (pandas.DataFrame) – The extracted table.

Returns:

Transformed table. This is equal to the input parameter table.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame
